Close open database object.

insertOrReplaceMetricInfo

public long insertOrReplaceMetricInfo(int id,
                                      String title,
                                      String description,
                                      int supported,
                                      float power,
                                      int mininterval,
                                      String maxrange,
                                      String resolution,
                                      int type)
Insert new metric group into MetricInfo table, or replace if the id already exist.

Parameters:
id - id which identifies metric group to insert
title - name of metric group
description - short description of metric
supported - metric support status on system [1-supported/0-not supported]
power - power used to monitor this metric (milliAmps)
mininterval - minimum possible interval between readings (milliseconds)
maxrange - maximum range measurable by metric, including units
resolution - resolution of measurements, including units
type - value representing metric type [system/sensor/user]
Returns:
rowid of inserted row, -1 on failure
See Also:
MetricInfoTable

insertOrReplaceMetrics

public long insertOrReplaceMetrics(int id,
                                   int group,
                                   String metric,
                                   String units,
                                   float max)
Insert new metric into Metrics table, or replace if the id already exist.

Parameters:
id - id which identifies individual metric to insert
group - id of metric group this metric belongs to
metric - name of metric
units - units of metric values
max - maximum potential value
Returns:
rowid of inserted row, -1 on failure
See Also:
MetricsTable

insertData

public long insertData(int metric,
                       int monitor,
                       long timestamp,
                       float value)
Insert new reading into Data table.

Parameters:
metric - id of metric
monitor - id of monitor
timestamp - timestamp measured from uptime (milliseconds)
value - value of reading
Returns:
rowid of inserted row, -1 on failure
See Also:
DataTable

insertBatchData

public long insertBatchData(int metric,
                            int monitor,
                            ArrayList<DataEntry> data)
Insert batch of new data into Data table. Batch comes as array list of DataEntry (timestamp - data pairs).

Parameters:
metric - id of metric
monitor - id of monitor
data - array list of DataEntry pairs
Returns:
number of rows inserted (should equal size of _data_ array list on success)
See Also:
DataTable

insertMonitor

public int insertMonitor(long offsettime)
Insert new monitor into Monitor table, automatically generating monitor id.

Parameters:
offsettime - time offset to apply to data table times to acquire time from epoch, in milliseconds
Returns:
new monitor id
See Also:
MonitorTable

deleteMetricInfo

public int deleteMetricInfo(int metric)
Delete metric group from MetricInfo table.

Parameters:
metric - id which identifies metric group to delete
Returns:
number of rows deleted (should be 0 or 1)
See Also:
MetricInfoTable

deleteMetrics

public int deleteMetrics(int group)
Delete metrics from Metrics table matching a specified group.

Parameters:
group - id of metric group to remove
Returns:
number of rows deleted
See Also:
MetricsTable

purgeData

public int purgeData(int monitorID)
Purge old data from Data table. Any records related to monitors older than the provided monitorID will be removed.

Parameters:
monitorID - oldest monitor that should remain in Data table after purge
Returns:
number of rows deleted
See Also:
DataTable

query

public Cursor query(SQLiteQueryBuilder queryBuilder,
                    String[] projection,
                    String selection,
                    String[] selectionArgs,
                    String sortOrder)
Perform query on database using pre-constructed query builder.

Parameters:
queryBuilder - query to perform on database
projection - the list of columns to put into the cursor. If null all columns are included
selection - A selection criteria to apply when filtering rows. If null then all rows are included
selectionArgs - You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings
sortOrder - How the rows in the cursor should be sorted. If null then the provider is free to define the sort order
Returns:
a Cursor or null
